subject: Personal Finance
title: How Central Banks Work
description: A quick, practical guide to How Central Banks Work.

hook.text: The Federal Reserve can create billions of dollars with a keystroke. No printing press required.

buildup.text: Central banks manage the money supply and interest rates to stabilize the economy.

discovery.text: They raise rates to cool inflation and lower rates to stimulate borrowing and spending.

twist.text: Central banks are intentionally independent from politicians. Mixing politics with monetary policy is dangerous.

climax.text: Every central bank walks a tightrope: too much stimulation causes inflation, too little causes recession.

punchline.text: One institution quietly steers the entire economy.

quiz.question: What is a central bank's main tool for managing the economy?
